name: openshift-launchpad
shortDescription: A bare bones starter kit that anyone can understand and use to build a 3-tier app and deploy to OpenShift
longDescription: This component was created to meet the perceived demand for something that would improve the initial experience of new teams working in the BCDevExchange environment and on OpenShift in particular. The amount of work that a new (unfamiliar) team needs to do to get something simple running is consistently about 3 weeks. Using this product as a boilerplate, they can have 'hello world' running and deployed in OpenShift much faster and then begin creating code that provides business value sooner.

testimonials.quotation: Wow, this thing was the greatest thing ever.
Wow, this thing was the best thing ever.
Wow, this thing was the coolest thing ever.

name: BC Address Geocoder
shortDescription: Resolve the physical locations and correct, standardized form of civic and non-civic addresses in British Columbia.
longDescription: The BC Address Geocoder is a REST web service that can be used to resolve the physical locations (i.e., latitude and longitude) and correct, standardized form of civic and non-civic addresses in British Columbia.
supportAgreement: Available Monday through Friday (except Holidays) from 8:30am to 4:30pm (PST) by calling the Service Desk at 1-866-952-6801 or emailing the service desk at NRS.ServiceDesk@gov.bc.ca.

testimonials.quotation: Wow, this thing was the greatest thing ever.
Wow, this thing was the best thing ever.
Wow, this component changed my life.

name: BC Route Planner
shortDescription: Find the best vehicle route between two points in B.C.
longDescription: The B.C. Route Planner is a REST web service that offers vehicle route plans that are based on the B.C. Digital Road Atlas. The B.C. Route Planner computes the shortest or fastest route between start and end points and returns the route, distance, time, and directions.

name: Common Hosted Email Service
shortDescription: Use structured datasets and business templates to automatically populate printable documents, spreadsheets, presentations, or PDFs.

name: BC Government on-premise PaaS
shortDescription: Build and deploy modern, cloud-native applications using BC's on-premise DevOps platform.
longDescription: The BC Gov OpenShift Container Platform Service is a multi-tenant container platform that government application development teams may use to develop and deploy modern, cloud native software applications. The service provides development teams with a set of isolated project spaces (namespaces) with associated resource quotas in which they can develop and deploy their applications and tools supporting their development lifecycle - from day-to-day development through to production
supportAgreement: Submit support requests via the BC Government Help Desk by telephoning 250 387-7000 or emailing 77000@gov.bc.ca.
